PARAGRAPH.STRING: ([Tutch: Nederland] ([IPA: ˈne:dərlɑnt]) is the European part of the Kingdom of the Netherlands (Dutch: Koninkrijk der Nederlanden), which is formed by
is a constitutional monarchy, located in northwestern Europe.
is bordered by the North Sea to the north and west, Belgium to the south, and Germany to the east. The current borders were established in 1839.

is often referred to by the name Holland. This is not terminologically precise, since the provinces of North and South Holland in the western Netherlands are only two of the country's twelve provinces (for more on this and other naming issues see Netherlands (terminology)).

is also sometimes known as the Low Countries, which is the meaning of the original Dutch title Nederlanden. The Dutch title has now changed to Nederland, the Low Country, but this version has not been adopted in the English language.
is a densely populated and geographically low-lying country (
name literally means "low countries" or "low lands") and
windmills, cheese, clogs (wooden shoes), dikes, tulips, bicycles and social tolerance.
policies are liberal toward drugs, prostitution, same-sex marriage, abortion and euthanasia.
is host to the International Criminal Tribunal for the Former Yugoslavia, the International Court of Justice and the International Criminal Court at The Hague.
